title: Grilled Panzanella Salad with Peaches and Fennel

instructions.1: Cut a large piece of Reynolds Wrap® Non Stick Aluminum Foil and firmly fit it over the grill grate. Heat the grill to medium heat.
instructions.2: While the grill is heating, make the dressing. To a shallow bowl, add the shallot, vinegar, maple syrup, and a couple pinches of salt and pepper to taste. Let the mixture sit until the shallots are tender, about 10 minutes. Add 4 tablespoons of the oil and whisk until the dressing is mixed and blended. Set aside.
instructions.3: Cut the garlic clove in half. Gently rub both sides of each slice of bread with the cut side of the garlic. Using 1 tablespoon of oil, lightly brush each side of the bread.
instructions.4: Place the bread on the hot grill and cook until toasted and firm, about 7 to 10 minutes. Remove the bread and let cool.
instructions.5: Brush the peaches with the remaining tablespoon of oil and sprinkle with a couple pinches of salt. Place the peaches on the foil-covered grill and cook until lightly browned but firm, about 4 to 5 minutes. Remove from heat and set aside.
instructions.6: In a large serving bowl, toss together the arugula and basil. Tear the bread into large chunks and add to the bowl. Add the peaches and fennel. Mix in the dressing and give everything a thorough toss.

questions.question: In Step 4, is the grill from Step 1 being used?
Is grill from Step 1 used in multiple future steps without being redefined?
Is dressing from Step 2 used in multiple future steps without being redefined?
Is bread from Step 3 used in multiple future steps without being redefined?
Is peaches from Step 5 used in multiple future steps without being redefined?
Is couple pinches from Step 2 still available in Step 6?
What is the last time interval specified in Step 2?
If we skip Step 3, is it still valid to tear the bread in Step 6?
Can we cut (Step 1) and toss (Step 6) at the same time?
